tool.name: p11tool
tool.title: GnuTLS PKCS #11 tool
tool.description: Program to handle PKCS #11 smart cards and security modules.
tool.detail:
Program that allows operations on PKCS #11 smart cards
and security modules. 

To use PKCS #11 tokens with GnuTLS the p11-kit configuration files need to be setup.
That is create a .module file in /etc/pkcs11/modules with the contents 'module: /path/to/pkcs11.so'.
Alternatively the configuration file /etc/gnutls/pkcs11.conf has to exist and contain a number
of lines of the form 'load=/usr/lib/opensc-pkcs11.so'.

You can provide the PIN to be used for the PKCS #11 operations with the environment variables
GNUTLS_PIN and GNUTLS_SO_PIN.

options.description: List all available tokens
List the URLs available tokens
options.detail: This is a more compact version of --list-tokens.

options.description: List all available mechanisms in a token
Initializes a PKCS #11 token
Initializes/Resets a PKCS #11 token user PIN
Initializes/Resets a PKCS #11 token security officer PIN
options.detail:
This initializes the security officer's PIN. When used non-interactively use the GNUTLS_NEW_SO_PIN
environment variables to initialize SO's PIN.

options.description: Specify the PIN to use on token operations
options.detail: Alternatively the GNUTLS_PIN environment variable may be used.

options.description: Specify the Security Officer's PIN to use on token initialization
options.detail: Alternatively the GNUTLS_SO_PIN environment variable may be used.

options.description: List all available objects in a token
options.detail:
All objects available in the token will be listed. That includes
objects which are potentially unaccessible using this tool.

options.description: List all available certificates in a token
options.detail:
That option will also provide more information on the
certificates, for example, expand the attached extensions in a trust
token (like p11-kit-trust).

options.description: List all certificates that have an associated private key
options.detail:
That option will only display certificates which have a private
key associated with them (share the same ID).

options.description: List all available private keys in a token
options.detail: Lists all the private keys in a token that match the specified URL.

options.description: List all available certificates marked as trusted
Export the object specified by the URL
Export the certificate object specified by the URL
options.detail:
Exports the certificate specified by the URL while including any attached extensions to it.
Since attached extensions are a p11-kit extension, this option is only
available on p11-kit registered trust modules.

options.description: Export the certificate specified by the URL and its chain of trust
options.detail: Exports the certificate specified by the URL and generates its chain of trust based on the stored certificates in the module.

options.description: Export the public key for a private key
options.detail: Exports the public key for the specified private key

options.description: List information on an available object in a token
Generate private-public key pair of given type
options.detail:
Generates a private-public key pair in the specified token.
Acceptable types are RSA, ECDSA, Ed25519, and DSA. Should be combined with --sec-param or --bits.

options.description: Generate an RSA private-public key pair
options.detail:
Generates an RSA private-public key pair on the specified token.
Should be combined with --sec-param or --bits.

options.description: Generate a DSA private-public key pair
options.detail:
Generates a DSA private-public key pair on the specified token.
Should be combined with --sec-param or --bits.

options.description: Generate an ECDSA private-public key pair
options.detail:
Generates an ECDSA private-public key pair on the specified token.
Should be combined with --curve, --sec-param or --bits.

options.description: Specify the number of bits for the key generate
options.detail:
For applications which have no key-size restrictions the
--sec-param option is recommended, as the sec-param levels will adapt
to the acceptable security levels with the new versions of gnutls.

options.description: Specify the curve used for EC key generation
options.detail: Supported values are secp192r1, secp224r1, secp256r1, secp384r1 and secp521r1.

options.description: Specify the security level
options.detail: This is alternative to the bits option. Available options are [low, legacy, medium, high, ultra].

options.description: Set the CKA_ID (in hex) for the specified by the URL object
options.detail: Modifies or sets the CKA_ID in the specified by the URL object. The ID should be specified in hexadecimal format without a '0x' prefix.

options.description: Set the CKA_LABEL for the specified by the URL object
options.detail: Modifies or sets the CKA_LABEL in the specified by the URL object

options.description: Writes the loaded objects to a PKCS #11 token
options.detail:
It can be used to write private, public keys, certificates or secret keys to a token. Must be combined with one of --load-privkey, --load-pubkey, --load-certificate option.

When writing a certificate object, its CKA_ID is set to the same CKA_ID of the corresponding public key, if it exists on the token; otherwise it will be derived from the X.509 Subject Key Identifier of the certificate. If this behavior is undesired, write the public key to the token beforehand.

options.description: Deletes the objects matching the given PKCS #11 URL
Sets a label for the write operation
Sets an ID for the write operation
options.detail: Sets the CKA_ID to be set by the write operation. The ID should be specified in hexadecimal format without a '0x' prefix.

options.description: Marks the generated key to be a wrapping key
options.detail: Marks the generated key with the CKA_WRAP flag.

options.description: Marks the object to be written as trusted
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_TRUST flag.

options.description: When retrieving objects, it requires the objects to be distrusted
options.detail:
Ensures that the objects retrieved have the CKA_X_TRUST flag.
This is p11-kit trust module extension, thus this flag is only valid with
p11-kit registered trust modules.

options.description: Marks the object to be written for decryption
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_DECRYPT flag set to true.

options.description: Marks the object to be written for signature generation
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_SIGN flag set to true.

options.description: Marks the object to be written as a CA
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_CERTIFICATE_CATEGORY as CA.

options.description: Marks the object to be written as private
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_PRIVATE flag. The written object will require a PIN to be used.

options.description: Marks the object to be written as always authenticate
options.detail: Marks the object to be generated/written with the CKA_ALWAYS_AUTHENTICATE flag. The written object will Mark the object as requiring authentication (pin entry) before every operation.

options.description: Provide a hex encoded secret key
options.detail: This secret key will be written to the module if --write is specified.

options.description: Private key file to use
Public key file to use
Certificate file to use
Enable debugging
options.detail: Specifies the debug level.

options.description: Output file
Force (user) login to token
Force security officer login to token
options.detail: Forces login to the token as security officer (admin).

options.description: Tests the signature operation of the provided object
options.detail:
It can be used to test the correct operation of the signature operation.
If both a private and a public key are available this operation will sign and verify
the signed data.

options.description: Sign with a specific signature algorithm
options.detail:
This option can be combined with --test-sign, to sign with
a specific signature algorithm variant. The only option supported is 'RSA-PSS', and should be
specified in order to use RSA-PSS signature on RSA keys.

options.description: Hash algorithm to use for signing
options.detail: This option can be combined with test-sign. Available hash functions are SHA1, RMD160, SHA256, SHA384, SHA512, SHA3-224, SHA3-256, SHA3-384, SHA3-512.

options.description: Generate random data
options.detail: Asks the token to generate a number of bytes of random bytes.

options.description: Use PKCS #8 format for private keys
Use DER/RAW format for input
options.detail: Use DER/RAW format for input certificates and private keys.

options.description: Use DER format for output certificates, private keys, and DH parameters
options.detail: The output will be in DER or RAW format.

options.description: Specify the PKCS #11 provider library
options.detail: This will override the default options in /etc/gnutls/pkcs11.conf

options.description: Specify parameters for the PKCS #11 provider library
options.detail:
This is a PKCS#11 internal option used by few modules.
    Mainly for testing PKCS#11 modules.

options.description: Print detailed URLs
Print a compact listing using only the URLs
Disable all interaction with the tool
options.detail: In batch mode there will be no prompts, all parameters need to be specified on command line.
